attributes.action: Renegotiate with EU for a free trade deal or leave EU with no deal.
attributes.additional_details:
We currently trade with the rest of the world under WTO regulations. This does not currently create customs or border issues so should not be feared as the result of a no deal.
If we could establish a free trade deal with EU for goods and farm produce, there would be no need for either a hard border between NI and the Irish Republic, nor between differing parts of the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Mrs May originally said "no deal is better than a bad deal". The current draft Brexit deal is a bad deal that does not achieve the detailed outcomes she originally described for Brexit. She should negotiate a free trade deal for the UK (ie no hard border required with Eire) or leave with no deal.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take specific action.

We are not sure exactly what you mean by "a free trade deal".

You could start a new petition requesting that the UK Government leave without a withdrawal agreement and negotiate for a free trade deal with the EU that only covers goods and farm products if that is something you would like to see happen.
